meanings.sent1: The impurer water from the old well was not safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The impurer air in the city made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent3: The impurer milk in the fridge had turned sour and smelled awful.
meanings.sent4: Her impurer thoughts clouded her judgment like a dark storm.
meanings.sent5: The impurer oil caused the engine to sputter and fail.

meanings.definition: Having a lower moral or ethical standard.
meanings.sent1: He was known for his impurer intentions and deceitful actions.
meanings.sent2: The impurer behavior of the politician shocked the public.
meanings.sent3: The impurer student tried to cheat on the exam but got caught.
meanings.sent4: Her impurer motives were revealed when she betrayed her friend.
meanings.sent5: The impurer character in the story met a tragic end due to his actions.

meanings.definition: Made less pure by the addition of something else.
meanings.sent1: The impurer gold was mixed with copper to reduce its value.
meanings.sent2: The impurer wine had a strange taste due to added sugar.
meanings.sent3: The impurer air in the room was filled with the scent of fresh flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her impurer coffee was sweetened with sugar and cream.
meanings.sent5: The impurer gemstone sparkled less brightly than the pure diamond.
